dendromatics: Automatic dendrometry in terrestrial point clouds

This package provides functionalities to implement an updated version of algorithm presented in [CABO2018] to detect the trees present in a terrestrial 3D point cloud from a forest plot, and compute individual tree parameters: tree height, tree location, diameters along the stem (including DBH), and stem axis.

Contents

  • Installation
  • Algorithm
    • 1. Identification of stems among user-provided horizontal stripe
    • 2. Tree individualization based on point-to-stems distances
    • 3. Computation of stem diameter at different section heights
  • Functions
    • Voxelization
    • Height-normalization
    • Stem extraction
    • Tree individualization
    • Computing sections
    • Drawing LAS files
  • Examples
    • Height-normalization
    • Identifying stems from a stripe
    • Individualizing trees
    • Computing sections along the stems
    • Tilt detection
  • 3DFIN
  • CloudCompare plugin

References

[CABO2018]

Cabo, C., Ordonez, C., Lopez-Sanchez, C. A., & Armesto, J. (2018). Automatic dendrometry: Tree detection, tree height and diameter estimation using terrestrial laser scanning. International Journal of Applied Earth Observation and Geoinformation, 69, 164–174. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jag.2018.01.011

[ESTE2018]

Ester, M., Kriegel, H.-P., Sander, J., & Xu, X. (1996). A Density-Based Algorithm for Discovering Clusters in Large Spatial Databases with Noise. www.aaai.org

[PREN2021]

Prendes, C., Cabo, C., Ordonez, C., Majada, J., & Canga, E. (2021). An algorithm for the automatic parametrization of wood volume equations from Terrestrial Laser Scanning point clouds: application in Pinus pinaster. GIScience and Remote Sensing, 58(7), 1130–1150. https://doi.org/10.1080/15481603.2021.1972712
